alert.note: Alert for Big Island East; Big Island North; Kauai East; Kipahulu; Koolau Windward; Molokai Southeast; Molokai Windward; Olomana; Windward Haleakala (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Warning issued December 17 at 6:44PM HST until December 18 at 6:00PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...HIGH SURF WARNING FOR THE EAST FACING SHORES OF KAUAI OAHU MOLOKAI MAUI AND BIG ISLAND... .Surf along exposed east facing shores will peak Monday morning at warning levels as a short lived large long period northeast (40 degrees) swell builds through the island chain late tonight. A downward trend is expected by Monday evening dipping below warning levels. ...HIGH SURF WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM HST MONDAY... * WHAT...Surf 14 to 18 feet. * WHERE...Olomana, Kauai East, Koolau Windward, Molokai Windward, Molokai Southeast, Windward Haleakala, Kipahulu, Big Island East and Big Island North. * WHEN...Surf will peak early Monday morning, then slowly ease Monday evening. * IMPACTS...Very High...Expect ocean water surging and sweeping across beaches, coastal benches, and lava flows creating the potential for impacts to coastal properties and infrastructure, including roadways. Powerful longshore and rip currents will be present at most beaches. Large breaking waves and strong currents may impact harbor entrances and channels causing challenging boat handling.
info.instruction: Stay away from the shoreline along the affected coasts. Be prepared for road closures. Postpone entering or leaving channels affected by the high surf until the surf subsides.

area.areaDesc: Big Island East; Big Island North; Kauai East; Kipahulu; Koolau Windward; Molokai Southeast; Molokai Windward; Olomana; Windward Haleakala
